WorkItem.ClosedComment: You're obviously using the compatibility pack, because this file is actually an Excel2007 (OfficeOpenXML) file saved with an .xls extension rather than a .xlsx extension. You can read it using the Excel2007 Reader rather than the Excel5 Reader. If you're uncertain of the actual file format, then you can identify the reader to use with the PHPExcel_IOFactory::identify() method, or just let PHPExcel itself determine the correct reader to use and load the file automatically with the PHPExcel_IOFactory::load() method.
WorkItem.Description:
Hi All,
I am newbie to PHPEXCEL. I was almost comfortable in working with the examples provided with the package. The Problem comes when i moved for Hands-on.
Task : To open a excel file (already existing in .xls format) and write data to it.
I created a excel file (.xls 2003). When i run my script, I am shooted with error (attached the snapshot of the same):
 
( ! ) Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'Exception' with message 'The filename any.xls is not recognised as an OLE file' in C:\wamp\www\Classes\PHPExcel\Shared\OLERead.php on line 87
( ! ) Exception: The filename any.xls is not recognised as an OLE file in C:\wamp\www\Classes\PHPExcel\Shared\OLERead.php on line 87
Call Stack
#	Time	Memory	Function	Location
1	0.0055	373672	{main}( )	..\s.php:0
2	0.2513	5368048	PHPExcel_Reader_Excel5->load( )	..\s.php:16
3	0.2513	5368048	PHPExcel_Reader_Excel5->_loadOLE( )	..\Excel5.php:584
4	0.2563	5451160	PHPExcel_Shared_OLERead->read( )	..\Excel5.php:1069 
 
Please Advise...
Thanks in Advance.
Vathsan
WorkItem.Summary: Exceptions and Fatal Error - Problem: File not Recognized as OLE format.

Comments.Message: It's very difficult to tell what the problem is without seeing the file itself. PHPExcel doesn't recognise the bytemarks normally used to identify an OLE file, such as those generated by MS Office... specifically a byte sequence of 0xd0, 0xcf, 0x11, 0xe0, 0xa1, 0xb1, 0x1a, 0xe1 as the first 8 bytes of the file. Is it possible for you to upload the file as an attachment to this work item?

Hi Mark,
Yes. I have attached my excel file (named any.xls).
Thanks for the quick reply. 
I tried using another .xls created by the MS Office Version 2003. This worked perfect.
As per my understanding, the .xls file created by 2007 Version of MS Office generates the 8 bytes sequence and hence raised an exception. So, the quick fix that i have now for my problem is that, Create the .xls file from 2003 Office Environment and use them. 

Additional Information about my Work Environment:
OS: Windows 7
MS Office Version: 2007
PHP Version: 5.3.5
Server: WAMP

Please let me know if there is a fix for this.

Thanks Again,
Vathsan

Thanks Mark. 
That was a great help :-)
